ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson acknlowedges Perceptor but still holds a rather cold expression on his face, which was mostly meant for Legacy. Very well Perceptor, I will hold off

Tucson acknlowedges Perceptor but still holds a rather cold expression on h=
is face, which was mostly meant for Legacy.

"Very well Perceptor, I will h=
old off until we are able to contact the Pacificus Maximals.  If we can not=
 reach them, then we might have to resort to other measures."

In another r=
oom, Straight Shot could hear that Tucson had calmed down somewhat.  She si=
ghs in relief, as does Quickstride.

"That was close.  I'm glad we weren't =
in the same room with him."

Quickstride looks over to her.

"You've known =
him for a long time, how bad can he get?"

Straight Shot looks to him, whil=
e cuddling Elita.

" Let's just say that Legacy was really lucky he didn't =
decide to throw a punch at him.  One time, Tucson got into a real ugly figh=
t with a rookie Decepticon and he literally beat the guy up into scrap meta=
l. He took a few dents but nothing major..  But the look on his face, no on=
e not even a fellow Autobot would dare insult him after witnessing what he =
had done.  But he's never laid a hand on an Autobot, which actually has sto=
pped him from doing the same to Legacy."

Quickstride nodds.

"He came clos=
e this time.  I'd hate ta be on the receiving end of those fists."

Straigh=
t Shot peers into the room where Rodimus sits with Nightlight.

" Before Ro=
dimus snapped out of that dark phase of his, I don't think Tucson would hav=
e hesitated to smash him to smitherines also, if he couldn't find a way to =
help him. I'm glad he held it together and brought Rodimus back safely."

Q=
uickstride listens on.

" So that's why you really stick close ta the big g=
uy.  If he didn't have you ta even out his temper, Primus knows what he'd b=
e capable of."

Straight Shot nodds.

" It's his weakness, he's got the sho=
rtest temper of any Autobot, asside from Ratchet, who was well known for hi=
s short fuse.  You could've sworn those guys were related in some way.  Act=
ually, Tucson did intern with him for a while, and was the only Autobot who=
 actually got along nicely with the old Medic.  When he was a rookie, he wa=
s always willing to learn, and he always followed Ratchet's instructions to=
 the letter, before he got his optic sensors damaged of course."

Quickstri=
de shifts positions on a chair.

"Wow, he actually worked with Cybertron's =
finest Medic.  That's impressive."

Straight Shot nodds.

" He interned wit=
h him for a while, to aquire some mechanical training.  And at the same tim=
e, he trained with Master Yokitron and also did field work with Hound on oc=
casion.  He wanted to learn as much as he could, and he did.  He learned a =
lot of skills.  He also took up mechanics with Wheel Jack and did rather we=
ll there too.  That's where he aquired his restoration skills, which was to=
 him his all time favorite past time.  I think he really misses those days,=
 where he got to learn so much from everyone.  But the one thing he never g=
ot to do, was to learn the wisdom that Optimus Prime was most legendary for=
.  I think that's what's bothering him the most Quickstride."

Without furt=
her word, Tucson quietly walks over to the body of Optimus Prime, and just =
stands beside him.  It would appear that Straight Shot was right.  He had l=
earned so much, but missed the opportunity to learn the wisdom he feared he=
 was missing.  He kneels in front of the sleeping Autobot Commander.

" Onc=
e again I almost made a costly mistake.  I learned so much from my comrades=
 and I'm grateful for the knowledge they've given me, but still, Optimus, I=
 wish I could have learned your wisdom.  I could really use it now.  So muc=
h happening at once and I don't know where to begin doing something about i=
t.  I should know these things by now, that's why I was given the power of =
leadership.  I can't let them down, not this time.  My comrades have seen e=
nough grief, they don't need any more of it.  Now I wish we did have time t=
o work together, one on one.  That way I would be prepared for what comes n=
ext."

nd

ially

ickly.

of voice! 
> It's as if you're trying to stop me from doing what needs to b=
e done!  This 
> war can not be fought by ourselves, they out number us! An=
d I will do 
> everything in my power to be sure that our numbers stay stab=
le!"
> 
> Straight Shot swallows hard, she holds Elita in her arms, knowing=
 that when 
> Tucson loses his temper, the whole planet would pretty much k=
now that it was 
> time to leave him alone.
> 
> "Not good, so not good.  I=
f there's one thing I learned was not ta get on 
> Tucson's bad side. Not p=
retty."
> 
> She turns to Rodimus.
> 
> " I've seen what happens when someo=
ne pushes his buttons the wrong way. He's 
> like Ratchet, but kind of thre=
e times worse.  If he wants ta turn a bot inta 
> scrap metal, he'll do it.=
  It's happened before..  Umm, maybe I shouldn't - 
> have mentioned that h=
uh?"
> 
> Quickstride now hears Tucson raising his voice, and looks up to h=
im.
> 
> "Uh ohh..  Something tells me we better take cover."
> 
> It was a=
pparent in the clenching of his fists, that Tucson was quite ready 
> to de=
fend his arguements in any means possible.  It was what he did when he 
> o=
ften lost his temper.  Straight Shot takes the brave step to try and calm 
=
> him down.
> 
> "Hey, maybe you guys can work something out?  You're right=
, we do need help 
> but Legacy's right too.  It might upset the time balan=
ce if we attempt ta 
> wake up the Ark too soon."
> 
> Tucson turns to her.=

> 
> " Remember what Master Yokitron told us vorns ago?"
> 
> She nodds.
>=
 
> "Yes, sometimes the unthinkable must be the thinkable.  It was his way =
of 
> saying that in desperate times, desperate measures can not be avoided=
.  Even 
> if the balance of time does get disrupted."
> 
> He nodds.
> 
> =
" Exactly.  We need help, and maybe it isn't time to wake up Optimus Prime,=
 
> but we must try and revive others to assist us in battle.  Legacy, I wa=
rn 
> you now, insubordination will not be tolerated.  Am I understood?"
